title: Famous actor Umer Sharif remembered on his death anniversary
content:
ISLAMABAD, Oct 02 (APP): Renowned actor, King of Comedy, TV and stage personality, Umer Sharif was remembered on his second death anniversary on Monday.
He was born on April 19, 1960 in Karachi, Umer Sharif started his career from Karachi as a stage performer at the age of 19 in 1974.
Some of his popular comedy stage plays include “Bakra Qistoon Pe” and “Buddha Ghar Pe Hy”.
Mr 420, Mr Charlie, Ghunda Raj, Laat Sahab, Kundan, But Shikan and Chand Babu were some of his movies.
Umer Sharif received National awards for Best Director and Best Actor in 1992. He was the only actor to receive four Nigar Awards in a single year. He also received three Graduate Awards.
Umer Sharif was also a recipient of Tamgha-e-Imtiaz by the government of Pakistan.
He died on October 2,2021 in Germany due to protected illness.
